title: Should you invest in BrewDog? Three better ways to invest in beer
text:
Brewing company BrewDog is targeting first-year university students to become shareholders but experts have argued this is not the best way to make money from craft beer.

The company, which sells its own-brand beer, is aiming to raise £7m from new shareholders. In return for a minimum £25 investment it offers perks such as a 5pc discount at BrewDog bars, a 10pc discount online, exclusive access to new beers and a free birthday beer.

It had previously raised £67m from more than 90,000 people. Existing shareholders have seen the value of their holding grow – some by 10 times their initial investment.

However, as the business is unlisted, shares cannot be easily sold. The return can only be realised...
